div.head: Provisions for the work of Colchos
div.ab: 7 limbecks of glasse 2 lbs. of â˜¿ One measure of coarse salt 6 unleaded earthenware vessel 2 large unleaded pots for calcinating 2 alembics to distill vinegar 4 pots of good vinegar 3 or 4 lamps 2 lbs. of cotton One pair of scissors

div.head: For the furnace
div.ab: A coffer with a wide stone of ten square pousses, and a thickness of one pied, pierced in the middle 2 boxes or earthenware pots with a lid 2 small pipes of white iron to evacuate the smoke from the furnace Turnipseed oil for the lamps to heat the furnace A fire-steel
One pound & a half of vitriol As much saltpeter As much rock alum

div.head: Glass vessel
div.ab:
The glass vessel must be either pear-shaped or round pyramid-shaped, of the same thickness as the small back of a knife, round on the bottom without folding over on itself, like flasks, its opening of such a size that a Dutch feather can just about get in, & with a lip at the end, in this way of the height of seven fingers' width.
